subtitleNullable: Furnas Hydroeletric Power Plant image obtained from Landsat-8 satelite
descriptionNullable:
### Context
Traditional machine learning algorithms very often assume statistically independent data samples. However, this is not the case in remote sensing image applications, in which pixels present spatial and temporal dependencies. Thus, pixel-based classification plays a vital role in many remote sensing applications, such as land cover and target recognition, just to name a few.

### Content

The dataset is composed of .tiff versions of the images. The folder comprehends two types of images: colorized version and annotated ground-truth.

The Landsat-8 satelite has acquired the images over the region of Alfenas, Minas Gerais, Brazil. Additionally, all images have a resolution of 288x156 pixels and have been annotated to depict the following classes:
* high level of turbidity;
* average level of turbidity;
* low level of turbidity; and
* water plants.

### Acknowledgements

If you use this dataset, we would be greatly thankful if you cite the following work:

* R. Pisani et al. "River sediment yield classification using remote sensing imagery". Pattern Recogniton in Remote Sensing (PRRS), 2016 9th IAPR Workshop (2016): 1-6

### Inspiration

* Fulfill the literature gap in remote sensing images, especially from Brazilian hydroeletrical power plants;
* How to improve land cover classification;
* Do traditional classifiers are often sufficient to overcome such a task;
* How the proposed task might benefit from more modern Computer Vision approaches.
